3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* postscreen_early 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* postscreen pre-handshake tests
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <postscreen.h>
10/*
11/* void psc_early_init(void)
12/*
13/* void psc_early_tests(state)
14/* PSC_STATE *state;
15/* DESCRIPTION
16/* psc_early_tests() performs protocol tests before the SMTP
17/* handshake: the pregreet test and the DNSBL test. Control
18/* is passed to the psc_smtpd_tests() routine as appropriate.
19/*
20/* psc_early_init() performs one-time initialization.
21/* LICENSE
22/* .ad
23/* .fi
24/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
25/* AUTHOR(S)
26/* Wietse Venema
27/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
28/* P.O. Box 704
29/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
30/*
31/* Wietse Venema
32/* Google, Inc.
33/* 111 8th Avenue
34/* New York, NY 10011, USA
35/*--*/
36
37/* System library. */
38
39#include <sys_defs.h>
40#include <sys/socket.h>
41#include <limits.h>
42
43/* Utility library. */
44
45#include <msg.h>
46#include <stringops.h>
47#include <mymalloc.h>
48#include <vstring.h>
49
50/* Global library. */
51
52#include <mail_params.h>
53
54/* Application-specific. */
55
56#include <postscreen.h>
57
58static char *psc_teaser_greeting;
59static VSTRING *psc_escape_buf;
60
61/* psc_whitelist_non_dnsbl - whitelist pending non-dnsbl tests */
62
63static void psc_whitelist_non_dnsbl(PSC_STATE *state)
64{
65 time_t now;
66 int tindx;
67
68 /*
69 * If no tests failed (we can't undo those), and if the whitelist
70 * threshold is met, flag non-dnsbl tests that are pending or disabled as
71 * successfully completed, and set their expiration times equal to the
72 * DNSBL expiration time, except for tests that would expire later.
73 *
74 * Why flag disabled tests as passed? When a disabled test is turned on,
75 * postscreen should not apply that test to clients that are already
76 * whitelisted based on their combined DNSBL score.
77 */
78 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_FAIL) == 0
79 && state->dnsbl_score < var_psc_dnsbl_thresh
80 && var_psc_dnsbl_wthresh < 0
81 && state->dnsbl_score <= var_psc_dnsbl_wthresh) {
82 now = event_time();
83 for (tindx = 0; tindx < PSC_TINDX_COUNT; tindx++) {
84 if (tindx == PSC_TINDX_DNSBL)
85 continue;
86 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_TODO(tindx))
87 && !(state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_PASS(tindx))) {
88 if (msg_verbose)
89 msg_info("skip %s test for [%s]:%s",
90 psc_test_name(tindx), PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state));
91 /* Wrong for deep protocol tests, but we disable those. */
92 state->flags |= PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_DONE(tindx);
93 /* This also disables pending deep protocol tests. */
94 state->flags |= PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_PASS(tindx);
95 }
96 /* Update expiration even if the test was completed or disabled. */
97 if (state->client_info->expire_time[tindx] < now + state->dnsbl_ttl)
98 state->client_info->expire_time[tindx] = now + state->dnsbl_ttl;
99 }
100 }
101}
102
103/* psc_early_event - handle pre-greet, EOF, and DNSBL results. */
104
105static void psc_early_event(int event, void *context)
106{
107 const char *myname = "psc_early_event";
108 PSC_STATE *state = (PSC_STATE *) context;
109 char read_buf[PSC_READ_BUF_SIZE];
110 int read_count;
111 DELTA_TIME elapsed;
112
113 if (msg_verbose > 1)
114 msg_info("%s: sq=%d cq=%d event %d on smtp socket %d from [%s]:%s flags=%s",
115 myname, psc_post_queue_length, psc_check_queue_length,
116 event, vstream_fileno(state->smtp_client_stream),
117 state->smtp_client_addr, state->smtp_client_port,
118 psc_print_state_flags(state->flags, myname));
119
120 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_REQUEST(vstream_fileno(state->smtp_client_stream),
121 psc_early_event, context);
122
123 /*
124 * XXX Be sure to empty the DNSBL lookup buffer otherwise we have a
125 * memory leak.
126 *
127 * XXX We can avoid "forgetting" to do this by keeping a pointer to the
128 * DNSBL lookup buffer in the PSC_STATE structure. This also allows us to
129 * shave off a hash table lookup when retrieving the DNSBL result.
130 *
131 * A direct pointer increases the odds of dangling pointers. Hash-table
132 * lookup is safer, and that is why it's done that way.
133 */
134 switch (event) {
135
136 /*
137 * We either reached the end of the early tests time limit, or all
138 * early tests completed before the pregreet timer would go off.
139 */
140 case EVENT_TIME:
141
142 /*
143 * Check if the SMTP client spoke before its turn.
144 */
145 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_TODO) != 0
146 && (state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_PREGR_FAIL_DONE) == 0) {
147 state->pregr_stamp = event_time() + var_psc_pregr_ttl;
148 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "pregreet test",
149 PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_PASS);
150 }
151 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL)
152 && psc_pregr_action == PSC_ACT_IGNORE) {
153 PSC_UNFAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL);
154 /* Not: PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE. Repeat this test the next time. */
155 }
156
157 /*
158 * Collect the DNSBL score, and whitelist other tests if applicable.
159 * Note: this score will be partial when some DNS lookup did not
160 * complete before the pregreet timer expired.
161 *
162 * If the client is DNS blocklisted, drop the connection, send the
163 * client to a dummy protocol engine, or continue to the next test.
164 */
165#define PSC_DNSBL_FORMAT \
166 "%s 5.7.1 Service unavailable; client [%s] blocked using %s\r\n"
167#define NO_DNSBL_SCORE INT_MAX
168
169 if (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_TODO) {
170 if (state->dnsbl_score == NO_DNSBL_SCORE) {
171 state->dnsbl_score =
172 psc_dnsbl_retrieve(state->smtp_client_addr,
173 &state->dnsbl_name,
174 state->dnsbl_index,
175 &state->dnsbl_ttl);
176 if (var_psc_dnsbl_wthresh < 0)
177 psc_whitelist_non_dnsbl(state);
178 }
179 if (state->dnsbl_score < var_psc_dnsbl_thresh) {
180 state->dnsbl_stamp = event_time() + state->dnsbl_ttl;
181 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "dnsbl test",
182 PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_PASS);
183 } else {
184 msg_info("DNSBL rank %d for [%s]:%s",
185 state->dnsbl_score, PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state));
186 PSC_FAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_FAIL);
187 switch (psc_dnsbl_action) {
188 case PSC_ACT_DROP:
189 state->dnsbl_reply = vstring_sprintf(vstring_alloc(100),
190 PSC_DNSBL_FORMAT, "521",
191 state->smtp_client_addr,
192 state->dnsbl_name);
193 PSC_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, STR(state->dnsbl_reply));
194 return;
195 case PSC_ACT_ENFORCE:
196 state->dnsbl_reply = vstring_sprintf(vstring_alloc(100),
197 PSC_DNSBL_FORMAT, "550",
198 state->smtp_client_addr,
199 state->dnsbl_name);
200 PSC_ENFORCE_SESSION_STATE(state, STR(state->dnsbl_reply));
201 break;
202 case PSC_ACT_IGNORE:
203 PSC_UNFAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_FAIL);
204 /* Not: PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE. Repeat this test. */
205 break;
206 default:
207 msg_panic("%s: unknown dnsbl action value %d",
208 myname, psc_dnsbl_action);
209
210 }
211 }
212 }
213
214 /*
215 * Pass the connection to a real SMTP server, or enter the dummy
216 * engine for deep tests.
217 */
218 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_NOFORWARD) != 0
219 || ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_PASS)
220 != PSC_STATE_FLAGS_TODO_TO_PASS(state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_TODO)))
221 psc_smtpd_tests(state);
222 else
223 psc_conclude(state);
224 return;
225
226 /*
227 * EOF, or the client spoke before its turn. We simply drop the
228 * connection, or we continue waiting and allow DNS replies to
229 * trickle in.
230 */
231 default:
232 if ((read_count = recv(vstream_fileno(state->smtp_client_stream),
233 read_buf, sizeof(read_buf) - 1, MSG_PEEK)) <= 0) {
234 /* Avoid memory leak. */
235 if (state->dnsbl_score == NO_DNSBL_SCORE
236 && (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_TODO))
237 (void) psc_dnsbl_retrieve(state->smtp_client_addr,
238 &state->dnsbl_name,
239 state->dnsbl_index,
240 &state->dnsbl_ttl);
241 /* XXX Wait for DNS replies to come in. */
242 psc_hangup_event(state);
243 return;
244 }
245 read_buf[read_count] = 0;
246 escape(psc_escape_buf, read_buf, read_count);
247 msg_info("PREGREET %d after %s from [%s]:%s: %.100s", read_count,
248 psc_format_delta_time(psc_temp, state->start_time, &elapsed),
249 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), STR(psc_escape_buf));
250 PSC_FAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL);
251 switch (psc_pregr_action) {
252 case PSC_ACT_DROP:
253 /* Avoid memory leak. */
254 if (state->dnsbl_score == NO_DNSBL_SCORE
255 && (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_TODO))
256 (void) psc_dnsbl_retrieve(state->smtp_client_addr,
257 &state->dnsbl_name,
258 state->dnsbl_index,
259 &state->dnsbl_ttl);
260 PSC_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, "521 5.5.1 Protocol error\r\n");
261 return;
262 case PSC_ACT_ENFORCE:
263 /* We call psc_dnsbl_retrieve() when the timer expires. */
264 PSC_ENFORCE_SESSION_STATE(state, "550 5.5.1 Protocol error\r\n");
265 break;
266 case PSC_ACT_IGNORE:
267 /* We call psc_dnsbl_retrieve() when the timer expires. */
268 /* We must handle this case after the timer expires. */
269 break;
270 default:
271 msg_panic("%s: unknown pregreet action value %d",
272 myname, psc_pregr_action);
273 }
274
275 /*
276 * Terminate the greet delay if we're just waiting for the pregreet
277 * test to complete. It is safe to call psc_early_event directly,
278 * since we are already in that function.
279 *
280 * XXX After this code passes all tests, swap around the two blocks in
281 * this switch statement and fall through from EVENT_READ into
282 * EVENT_TIME, instead of calling psc_early_event recursively.
283 */
284 state->flags |= PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_DONE;
285 if (elapsed.dt_sec >= PSC_EFF_GREET_WAIT
286 || ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_DONE)
287 == PSC_STATE_FLAGS_TODO_TO_DONE(state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_TODO)))
288 psc_early_event(EVENT_TIME, context);
289 else
290 event_request_timer(psc_early_event, context,
291 PSC_EFF_GREET_WAIT - elapsed.dt_sec);
292 return;
293 }
294}
295
296/* psc_early_dnsbl_event - cancel pregreet timer if waiting for DNS only */
297
298static void psc_early_dnsbl_event(int unused_event, void *context)
299{
300 const char *myname = "psc_early_dnsbl_event";
301 PSC_STATE *state = (PSC_STATE *) context;
302
303 if (msg_verbose)
304 msg_info("%s: notify [%s]:%s", myname, PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state));
305
306 /*
307 * Collect the DNSBL score, and whitelist other tests if applicable.
308 */
309 state->dnsbl_score =
310 psc_dnsbl_retrieve(state->smtp_client_addr, &state->dnsbl_name,
311 state->dnsbl_index, &state->dnsbl_ttl);
312 if (var_psc_dnsbl_wthresh < 0)
313 psc_whitelist_non_dnsbl(state);
314
315 /*
316 * Terminate the greet delay if we're just waiting for DNSBL lookup to
317 * complete. Don't call psc_early_event directly, that would result in a
318 * dangling pointer.
319 */
320 state->flags |= PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_DONE;
321 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_DONE)
322 == PSC_STATE_FLAGS_TODO_TO_DONE(state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_TODO))
323 event_request_timer(psc_early_event, context, EVENT_NULL_DELAY);
324}
325
326/* psc_early_tests - start the early (before protocol) tests */
327
328void psc_early_tests(PSC_STATE *state)
329{
330 const char *myname = "psc_early_tests";
331
332 /*
333 * Report errors and progress in the context of this test.
334 */
335 PSC_BEGIN_TESTS(state, "tests before SMTP handshake");
336
337 /*
338 * Run a PREGREET test. Send half the greeting banner, by way of teaser,
339 * then wait briefly to see if the client speaks before its turn.
340 */
341 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_TODO) != 0
342 && psc_teaser_greeting != 0
343 && PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, psc_teaser_greeting) != 0) {
344 psc_hangup_event(state);
345 return;
346 }
347
348 /*
349 * Run a DNS blocklist query.
350 */
351 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_TODO) != 0)
352 state->dnsbl_index =
353 psc_dnsbl_request(state->smtp_client_addr, psc_early_dnsbl_event,
354 (void *) state);
355 else
356 state->dnsbl_index = -1;
357 state->dnsbl_score = NO_DNSBL_SCORE;
358
359 /*
360 * Wait for the client to respond or for DNS lookup to complete.
361 */
362 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_TODO) != 0)
363 PSC_READ_EVENT_REQUEST(vstream_fileno(state->smtp_client_stream),
364 psc_early_event, (void *) state, PSC_EFF_GREET_WAIT);
365 else
366 event_request_timer(psc_early_event, (void *) state, PSC_EFF_GREET_WAIT);
367}
368
369/* psc_early_init - initialize early tests */
370
371void psc_early_init(void)
372{
373 if (*var_psc_pregr_banner) {
374 vstring_sprintf(psc_temp, "220-%s\r\n", var_psc_pregr_banner);
375 psc_teaser_greeting = mystrdup(STR(psc_temp));
376 psc_escape_buf = vstring_alloc(100);
377 }
378}
